metadata.Title: CVE-2022-42327 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: x86: unintended memory sharing between guests On Intel systems that support the "virtualize APIC accesses" feature, a guest can read and write the global shared xAPIC page by moving the local APIC out of xAPIC mode. Access to this shared page bypasses the expected isolation that should exist between two guests.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> hypervisor packages are in universe. For issues in the hypervisor, add appropriate tags to each section, ex: Tags_xen: universe-binary

criterions.comment: xen: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
